issue.title: Download eBooks from the Gutenberg mirrors instead
issue.body: Instead of using the main site. A list of mirrors is here: https://www.gutenberg.org/MIRRORS.ALL

issue.title: Create a CLI tool to upload eBooks

commits.message: Allow publisher to skip books in the collection.
Allow publisher to skip books in the collection.

Bookweave v1.1: Collections

Adding the concept of Book collections. There are two new types of
linked transactions used by bookweave: book and collection. A book
belongs to a single collection. The collection is mainyl used to define
what are the metadata tags for the associated books. A more
complete description about them is given in the README. This new
version is not backwards compatible. You may still use v1.0 to view old
transactions.

Also separating the book publisher from the distributed app.
You are not allowed anymore to publish the books through the web,
instead you need to use the Python publisher. The app is only for
visualization purposes, and it uses Arweave's GraphQL API. For this
reason, there is a major cleanup in the distributed app.

Bookweave v1.1: Collections

Adding the concept of Book collections. There are two new types of
linked transactions used by bookweave: book and collection. A book
belongs to a single collection. The collection is mainyl used to define
what are the metadata tags for the associated books. A more
complete description about them is given in the README. This new
version is not backwards compatible. You may still use v1.0 to view old
transactions.

Also separating the book publisher from the distributed app.
You are not allowed anymore to publish the books through the web,
instead you need to use the Python publisher. The app is only for
visualization purposes, and it uses Arweave's GraphQL API. For this
reason, there is a major cleanup in the distributed app.

Simplifying/Speeding up search

Replace ArQL calls with GraphQL for searching.
Also stop downloading data for every search result.
Simply provide the link, and let the user download it from arweave.net.
Remove nonsensical use of Promises within async functions

issue.title: What license?
issue.body: In a `COPYING` or `LICENSE` file would be nice, but something :)

issue.title: Understanding this project
issue.body:
Hi @marcojrfurtado,

Apologies in advance if this isn't the appropriate place to put this, but I'm unable to find your contact information. If you'd like to delete this issue, and respond to me via one of the methods in my Github profile, I totally understand.

I saw this project posted on Hacker News. I've been wanting to work on a library-related project for a while now, and I'd just recently been digging into Arweave and thought it seemed like a cool project, so this is something I'd love to contribute to. Right off the bat I think I can help you with UI and front-end dev.

Can you help me understand what the ultimate goal of this project is? Am I correct in assuming this project is basically just a method of injecting books into the Arweave blockchain? I would love to get a better high-level understanding of what you're trying to accomplish.

Thanks in advance!
